title: Newton's Laws of Motion

vocab.definition: A push or pull that can change an object's motion
The change in position of an object over time
An object's tendency to resist changes in motion
The rate at which an object's velocity changes
A force that opposes motion between surfaces

teachingNotes: Use everyday examples to explain Newton's laws. Demonstrate with simple experiments like rolling balls or pushing objects.

sample.question: What is a push or pull that can change an object's motion?

truefalse.question: An object at rest will stay at rest unless a force acts on it.

fillintheblank.question: An object's tendency to resist changes in motion is called ________.

shortanswer.question: What happens when you push harder on an object?
